senses.sense_definition: A disease affecting cattle caused by eating bones or decaying matter infected with botulinum toxin, often due to a lack of phosphorus; also known as lamziekte.

examples.text: The veterinarian suspected <w>parabotulism</w> when the cattle began showing signs of paralysis after grazing in the drought-stricken area.
Providing mineral supplements rich in phosphorus is a key strategy to prevent <w>parabotulism</w> in livestock.
